title: Managing your account, resources, and access docs
introduction: Leverage the interacting components and systems in your account for resource, user, and access management. Get started by setting up your IBM cloud account, learn about setting up an enterprise, or explore assigning access to resources quickly with IBM Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM).

section_recommended.title: Learn about different account types
section_recommended.description: Learn about the differences between Trial, Pay-As-You-Go, and Subscription account types.

section_recommended.title: Setting up your IBM Cloud account
section_recommended.description: Learn how to set up account authentication, manage your account settings, effectively organize resources in your account, and control access to resources.

section_recommended.title: Assigning access to resources
section_recommended.description: Get up and running quickly with IBM Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) by setting up access groups for quick access assignments, inviting users to your account, and managing their access.

tiles.title: Limit access with resource attribute-based conditions
tiles.description: You can now create a single IAM policy that grants access based on multiple resource attribute-based conditions.

tiles.title: Protect your private catalog and private products
tiles.description: Add an extra layer of protection to your private catalogs with context-based restrictions. Users can view the catalogs that you protect only if they satisfy your rule.

tiles.title: Symantec VIP 2FA is deprecated
tiles.description: If you are currently using Symantec VIP as your external authentication method, you can continue to use it and add subscribers as needed until 24 October 2024. If you are not already using Symantec VIP, then you can't purchase Symantec VIP to use as your external authentication method as of 24 October 2023. All customers currently using Symantec VIP must migrate to IBM Cloud MFA by 24 October 2024.
